verses.roman:
ācāryādi bhakta-gaṇe mililā prasāda diyā
mātā-ṭhāñi ājñā la-ilā māseka rahiyā

synonyms: ācārya-ādi—beginning with Advaita Ācārya; bhakta-gaṇe—all the devotees; mililā—he met; prasāda diyā—delivering the prasāda of Lord Jagannātha; mātā-ṭhāñi—from mother Śacī; ājñā la-ilā—took permission to leave; māseka rahiyā—remaining for one month.
translation: He then met all the other devotees, headed by Advaita Ācārya, and gave them the prasāda of Jagannātha. After staying for one month, he took permission from mother Śacī to leave.
